He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness session and this will be his first loan.  He  plans to use the loan amount to buy more more sheep to add to his stock.

In future, Jackson hopes to expand his business and open another butchery soon.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep to rear

loans.name: Johane

texts.en:
Johane is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Johane is working in a private institution as a clerk.

Johane has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Johane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Johane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been in the fruit sales business in Nakuru town for the last three years.  She is 41 years old and single with seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers during an awareness campaign and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of mangoes to sell in her business.

In future, Irene hopes to expand her business and supply fruit to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mangoes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Edward has a mechanic's shop that provides repair of vehicles & cars. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools needed for the mechanic's shop.

Edward has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Edward hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the mechanic's shop

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат проживает в городе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 46 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Она вместе с мужем занимается производством национальных видов тарелок (табаки чуби). Этим видом деятельности она занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения древесины и деревянных досок.
texts.en: Adolat lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She and her husband work in production of traditional dishware (tabaki chubi). She has been in this business for 25 years. She is requesting the loan for purchase of lumber and wood boards.

loans.use: To acquire lumber and wood boards.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy, 50, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a security guard and earns about USD 3 per day. Due to small income, Savy would like to run an additional business to generate extra income for the family. With this goal in mind, Savy is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a public transportation service. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a public transportation service

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 38 years old. He lives in Ijevan with his family, which consists of his wife and three school aged children: two daughters and a son. His wife is a nurse and she works at Ijevan polyclinic. 
Ara graduated from the Agricultural Academy and has engaged in trading for more than 18 years. In his shop, Ara sells food and household goods. He also has storage where he keeps flour and fodder for wholesale. Ara buys the major part of merchandise from suppliers but once or twice a month, Ara rents a car and goes to Yerevan to buy goods. 
Ara is asking for a $ 3,000 loan to buy various household goods and wholesale flour and fodder for resale

loans.use: to buy various household goods and wholesale flour and fodder for resale

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 53-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband and two working children. During her whole life, she was the one taking care of her family and she still does. She has been working in cleaning product sales on a freelance basis. She provides her customers with a good service in order to build an excellent relationship with them. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cleaning products for her business. She notes that this will improve her work therefore her returns. In the future, she plans to take out more Kiva loans, develop her business, and open her own cleaning products shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional cleaning products for her business

loans.name: Nematchon

texts.ru: Нематчон мужчина 50 лет, отец пятерых детей. Жена пенсионерка, домохозяйка. Сам работает трактористом в колхозе, его заработная плата очень минимальная, поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Сейчас у него три коровы, которые днём пасутся на пастбище. Из-за спада цен на скот, Нематчон решил в кредит купить ещё одну молодую корову.
texts.en: Nematchon is a 50 year old man and the father of five children. His wife is retired and a housewife. He himself is a tractor driver on a collective farm, but his salary is very small, so he also raises and sells cattle. Right now he has three cows which graze on pasture during the day. Because of the drop in price of livestock Nematchon decided to use a loan to buy another young cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 45 years old, married to Philip, and blessed with two children aged 18 and 12 years respectively. She is in the matatu (minibus) business which she ventured into seven years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 70,000.

She has requested a loan of KES.50,000 to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. The profit she makes would buy her another vehicle. She hopes to live a better life. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with one child.
 
James has a hardware shop that sells motorcycle and vehicle parts. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of motorcycle and vehicle parts.

James has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, James hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of motorcycle and vehicle parts.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime sells clothes to the residents of Likoni town, Kenya. She has four children and started off her business from the sale of farm produce.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is currently applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more clothes for sale. 

The main challenge facing the business is the seasonal business climate, but Mwatime is determined to set up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Marilou is making & peddling snacks like ice candy bars & cookies. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз жительница города Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сарвиноз живет вместе с родителями. Она занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. В этой области она пять лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Sarvinoz is a resident of the city of Vakhdat. She is 33 years old. She is divorced and has one child. Sarvinoz lives with her parents. She grows field crops, a business she has been in for five years. She is requesting a loan in order to plant wheat.

loans.use: plant wheat

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: Jartu is 23 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has two children aged 6 and 8, both attending school and living at home. For the past 4 years, she has been selling rubber dishes and used clothes in the local market. She started this business with the help of her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes and used clothes for her business. She plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Idrissa    K

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Idrissa from Tengbeh town Western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children aged 4 and 12 years.

Idrissa runs a Pharmacy at Wilberforce village. He sells paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, procaine injections (Novocain: type of anesthesia) and blood tonic. He has been running this business for 15 years. He began his business because he needed a permanent source of income to take care of his family. He works in the business 7 days per week and 18 hours a day. He also earns income from the patients he treats. He says that the main challenge for his business is that most of his customer do not have money for their medical bills.

Idrissa has requested a loan in order to buy more paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, procaine injections, and blood tonic. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, he plans to open a clinic. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more paracetamol tabs, malarial drugs, baby food, and procaine injections

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard has operated in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last thee years. He is 34 years old and married to Chebet; they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to diversify his business to start selling eggs. This will help him acquire more money to purchase another motorcycle.

In the future, Leonard hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will be using to transport eggs around the town.

loans.use: to diversify his business to start selling eggs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Peter has a karaoke shop that provides services where customers pay 5 pesos for every song. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan for 8,000 pesos to buy tools and to pay for the electricity for the videoke.

Peter has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Peter hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the videoke.

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru: Шарифгул проживает в городе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 41 год. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Шарифгул занимается растениеводством. Она берет кредит для закупа семян и вспашки земли. Она хочет посеять пшеницу.
texts.en: Sharifgul lives in the city of Vakhdat. She is married and 41 years old. Her husband is working in another country. Sharifgul grows crops for a living. She is requesting a loan for purchasing seed and ploughing the land. She plans to plant wheat.

loans.use: Buy seeds and plough the land

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Marilou has a shop that sells a variety of fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy stock of fish to sell.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Hadisamo

texts.ru: Хадисамо замужем. Ей 33 года. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Хадисамо уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Она у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Hadisamo is married and 33 years old. Her husband is working in Russia. Hadisamo herself has been raising livestock for four years. She keeps cattle at her house. She is requesting a loan to buy cows.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 13; all of them are attending school and live at home. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling rice, pepper and oil in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice and oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice and oil for her business.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of Forging Goals And Dreams Group

texts.es: Al termino del préstamo anterior las integrantes del Banco Mujer Forjando Sueños y Metas han aumentado su negocio incrementando la cantidad de cerdos. Además tuvieron la posibilidad de recibir unos talleres de   Capacitación en herramientas motivacionales para el éxito femenino en los negocios (combinación mujer, empresa, familia)con una estudiante que está terminando su practica profesional de una Universidad que ofrece estos servicios en forma voluntaria, pues fueron seleccionadas por la Fundación al ser un grupo sumamente organizado y responsable. En este momento se han añadido dos mujeres que han sido parte del Banco Mujer , pero que no habían solicitado crédito. Cada una de ellas recibirá 400.000 colones que podrán invertir en la compra de más cerdos y todo lo necesario para el desarrollo de los mismos. Este grupo es una clara muestra del beneficio que obtienen las mujeres en una de las zonas rurales de la provincia de San José.
texts.en: At the end of the previous loan the members of "Banco Mujer Forjando Sueños y Metas" (Women's Bank of Forging Goals and Dreams) had expanded their business by increasing the number of bred pigs. They also had the opportunity of receiving some training workshops in motivational tools for successful women in business (combining the subjects of women, business and family). The training was conducted by a university student who offered these trainings within her practical volunteering activities in the framework of her studies. After the training sessions the microfinance institution Fundación Mujer set up groups of borrowers, and this group stands out because it is particularly well organized and responsible. Right now the group has added two new members from Banco Mujer, who had not applied for previous loans. Each member will receive 400,000 colones, which they will invest in the purchase of pigs and needed supplies to breed them. This group is a clear demonstration of the benefits that women from rural areas in the province of San José can achieve.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed/nutrients.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Eric provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP18,000 to buy tools & to pay for gasoline for his services.

Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Mellie has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mellie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Vae

texts.en:
Vae is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a property owner and a landlady and her business has been in operation for ten years. She is married and has five school going children.

Vae is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to repair and complete her rental houses. She also sells fresh juices and water to the surrounding neighbors.

Her main challenge is that there are days she receives rent in arrears. She looks forward to own more rental houses.

loans.use: to repair and complete her rental houses.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is still managing his M-PESA shop and selling milk and milk products. His business is doing well. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to buy milk and milk products to sell and to help boost his Mpesa business.

He hopes to improve his business and buy a pickup to help him with transportation.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has 1 child. 

Florenda has a shop that sells dried fish & frozen foods like hotdogs & longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of dried fish & frozen foods to sell.

Florenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Florenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish & frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is fifty-year-old Marie. She is married, and has two children aged eight and seventeen. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to help with the household chores. 

In 2008, Marie established her African dresses, bags, soft drinks an cooking utensils. She began her business because she wants to be independent and to take care of her family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Marie plans to expand to the centre of town, setting up three shops and to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for African dresses, bags, soft drinks and cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Martha S.

texts.en: Martha is 36 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have three children between the ages of 5 to 15, all of them are attending school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a big business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Edwin is buying & peddling hypo (cleansing agent) by the liter. He also provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for 7 years. He requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of hypo to sell.

Edwin has been a member of HSPFI for since 2009. In the future, Edwin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of hypo to sell.

loans.name: Dessa

texts.en:
Dessa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Dessa has a retail shop in which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Dessa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dessa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Abass.  He is married and has four children aged 2, 5, 12 and 17. He has two additional dependents who live with him to assist in the business.  

In 1986, Abass established his business selling men's shoes, jeans, shorts, T-shirts. He began his business to make profit and to live up to expectations. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,100,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Abass has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to improve his stock, spending for jeans 1,000,000 Le, for T-shirts 1,000,000 Le, for shoes 3,000,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Abass plans to expand from a stall to a shop, to build a house, to improve the living standard of his family and to see that his business grows to a greater height. He is hard-working. The competition is moderate and the clients are able to cope.  Abass thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for  jeans, T-shirts, shoes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: This is 26 year-old Janet.  She is Divorced, and has 2 children aged 3 and 8. She has 1 additional dependent, who live with her to help a sister in the village with her child's education.  In 2009, Janet established her hair product, soft drinks and pure water business. She began her business to be self reliance and to take care of his family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,734,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Janet requires a loan in order to increase on her stock soft drinks Le 620,000, Le expression Le 820,000 rubber drinks Le 429,000 and body cream Le 400,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 546,800 . In the future, Janet plans to expand the shop to the centre of town, the loan shall maximize profit that can help her achieve this and to provide better education and medication for her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for hair products, soft drinks and pure water

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in Gardnersville. She is 25 years old and married.she has two children ages 4, both of them are twins, who are in school and live at home. 

For the past eight years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 31, is married and has a three-year-old child. He has one additional dependent who lives with him. 

In 2007 Michael opened his food and drink shop. Previously he was working at the front desk in one of the hotels in town. Because of the poor pay, he decided to set up his own business with his savings. Working seven days a week and fourteen hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. 

Michael is requesting a 4,500,000 SLL loan from ARD. He has already successfully repaid his previous loan and now needs a new loan in order to buy six cartons of luncheon meat for 180,000 SLL, twelve crates of Parrot Bay malt liquor at 48,000 SLL, twenty cartons of margarine for 75,000 SLL and six bags of sugar for 210,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 900,000 SLL. 

In the future, Michael plans to build a house from the proceeds of the business and see that his children receive a university education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 6 Catton luncheon meat @ Le.180,000, 12 crates parrot drinks @ Le.48,000,20 Cattons margarine butter @ Le.75,000 and 6 bags of sugar @ Le.210,000.

loans.name: Mariatu Nana

texts.en:
Mariatu, 46, is married to an accountant and has three children aged 25, 20 and 16 years. 

Previously, Mariatu was a civil servant, but she retired and went to Ivory Coast to seek a visa to go to the United States. Unfortunately, she was denied one, and when she went back home, there was no job for her. With her remaining money, she opened her provisions and drinks shop in 2006.

Working six days a week and ten hours a day, Mariatu earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL in order to buy twenty crates of soft drinks for 27, 000 SLL, twenty crates of Maltina beer for 35,000 SLL, eight cartons of sardines for 174,000 SLL and ten cartons of Peak Milk for 148,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to see her business expand and also would like to see her children educated to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions and drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 35 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 18. They are presently in school and live at home.

For the past five years she has been selling fashion clothes in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit, since she is the only one who is selling fashion around the community, especially during the Christmas season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old, single and has one child. She operates an orphanage and has been in the business for the past three years.

She was brought to KADET LTD. by a KADET LTD. client. This will be her first loan. She will use the whole amount to buy food commodities for sustaining the orphans.

Her dream is to expand the premises so as to accommodate more children.

loans.use: to buy food commodities for sustaining the orphans.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Carlos has pigpen and sells grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 15 years. He has equested a loan for PHP11,000 to purchase animal feeds for the pigs.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carlos hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and married to Rahab. They have eight children who are all in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his fifth loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to buy two bulls for fattening and resale. He was introduced to KADET LTD. by a fellow client.

He hopes to improve on his farming to boost his income and enable him educate his children.

loans.use: to buy two bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Esther has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells items like caldereta & afritada. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the food shop.

Esther has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Esther hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the food shop.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has six children between the ages of 11 to 25. All of her children are in school and live at home. For the past thirty two years she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 50 years old. She lives in a small village in South Georgia with her family: her husband Spartak and two daughters (30 and 27 years old). Laura’s husband has health problems and he receives a relevant pension from the government. 

Laura is leading the agricultural business of the family. She grows haricot and potatoes on a family-owned plot of the land. Her daughters assist her. In addition, the family owns a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Laura produces traditional Georgian cheese. She sells cheese and harvested vegetables at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris. 

Laura requested a loan for purchasing seeds for potatoes. This year, she plans to sow special, more expensive species. Laura will pay a higher price for the seeds, but, she will sell the harvest for a high price and the income of the family will increase. Laura plans to use the increased income for purchasing household goods in order to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Confiance Divine De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Jean est le coordinateur de son groupe Confiance Divine. Il est marie. Il a 6 enfants. Jean habite dans la région de Ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité 

Jean voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans votre entreprise de vente de charbon de bois. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise.

Des autres membres  RESTAURATION ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires.

Jean dit que ses défis principal est d agrandir son commerces.
texts.en:
Jean is the coordinator of the Confiance Divine (Divine Confidence) group. He is married. He has 6 children. Jean lives in the Ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water very restricted.

Jean would like to use this loan to invest in a charcoal selling business. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his enterprise.

Other members of RESTAURATION need a loan for businesses such as coal and foodstuffs.

Jean says that his principal challenge is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en:
Jacklin lives in Yambio. She is a charcoal seller, and has been in business for four years. She is 27 year old, married, and has five children between the ages of 14 and 2, three of whom are still in school. 

Jacklin heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in Yambio. She is a tea seller and has been in business for six years. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child, two years old. Her child is not yet in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 SDG in order to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee for sale.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Yambio. She is a food stall seller and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has five children between the ages of 10 and two years. Four of them are in school. 

Roda heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fee.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Florence T.

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s single and has three children ages 2 to 7 years old, respectively. They all live at home with their parents.

For four years now, Florence has been operating a grocery store where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items. Most interestingly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location.

Florence is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business

loans.name: Amistad 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the group coordinator for these five ladies.  Ana is a single mother of three children.  Her business consists of making hair products like shampoo, conditioner and anti-frizz serum as well as disinfectant for floors and home surfaces.  Ana purchases chemical products from local distributors to make her products and packs them for distribution.  Her finished products are sold in small grocery stores and in her own home.  In addition, Ana is a dressmaker, sewing clothes and decorative pieces like curtains, bathroom sets and bedspreads. 

Ana’s most important challenge is to see her children become professionals.  God has given her the strength to work hard as a single mother, to provide for her family and to send her children to study.  She enjoys sewing and making products.  She learned her last one around six years ago and, after completing all her classes, she decided to invest and produce products for hair, body and other uses.  She has received 15 loans with Esperanza and, with her first loan, she bought a sewing machine and started making student uniforms. With this loan, Ana will buy fabric to make bedspreads and bathroom set and chemical products (Sodium chloride, boric acid, menthol, methyl salicylate, glycerin, fruit fragrance, cetyl alcoohol, etc.) for hair and household products.

Ana's dream is to have a big factory to produce her chemical-based products and to sell them in other cities and in big department stores.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and chemical products.

loans.name: L' Amour De Madeline 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Patricia  est le coordinatrice de son groupe L`amour de Madeline 1, 2, 3 & 4.  EIle  est  mariée elle á deux enfants.

Patricia  habite dans la région de Madeline  d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Elle a dirigé son  commerce de produits alimentaires  pendant  3 années.

Patricia voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans l'achat de produits alimentaires. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son busines. Patricia : dit que ses défis principal est deveniez une grande commerçante.

Patricia dit que son but principal et son rêve est possède un entreprise personnel avec sa propre fond.
texts.en:
Patricia is the coordinator of the group "L' Amour de Madeline".  She is married and has two children.

She lives in the Madeline region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  She has been managing a retail food business for three years.

Patricia would like to use her loan to invest in the purchase of food products.  With this loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.  She says that her main challenge is to become a major retailer.  Her main goal and her dream is to own a business and have her own capital.

loans.use: to buy food products such as vegetables, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 37 years old and married to Mulwa and they have three children ages 21, 14, and seven years. She has been running her salon for a period of five years with an income of KES. 20,000.

Hellen is taking her fifth loan in KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to buy more beauty and hair products for the salon. 

She hopes to have an upscale salon and to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock like weaves,beauty products,chemicals.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old. He is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married to Serah. They have five children who are all in school.

Daniel has been selling timber and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to boost his timber business by buying more timber to add to his stock to sell.

He hopes to see his business grow and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Brenda has a shop where she sells spices, dried fish & dried squid. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of spices & dried fish to sell.

Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices & dried fish to sell

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Elmie has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elmie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elmie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana lives in Yei. She sells clothes and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are still in school. 

Viviana heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Yei. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is twenty-eight years old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arcelie has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Arcelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Arcelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mary Ann has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Nolkisaruni Enole

texts.en:
Nolkisaruni has been growing maize and wheat in Narok and the farming activity is doing great. Her monthly income is KES 14.000. 

She is borrowing her third loan from KADET LTD of KES 40,000 that she proposes to use to purchase fertilizer, wheat and maize seeds and prepare the land.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest back into her business. Her future dream is to be successful in her venture

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, wheat seeds and maize seeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  She sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Florence has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bunches of bananas. 

She also generates additional income through selling secondhand clothes.The main business challenges for Florence include transportation, thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale business and a delivery van for ease in transportation. She lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. 

Florence has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to build rental rooms. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (parents and late sisters children). 

Hadjah has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Hadjah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through selling bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Hadjah include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and to become a wholesaler.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Adelin

texts.en:
Adelin is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Adelin has a shop where she sells & makes snacks like pancakes & rice cakes or puto. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy snacks to sell & raw ingredients for making snacks.

Adelin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Adelin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks to sell & raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 38 years old and a single mother of one child. She has been in the egg distributing business for the past seven years.

She was brought to KADET LTD by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to purchase more trays of eggs to sell.

Her hope is to acquire capital that can help her expand her work premises.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Busy Five Group

texts.en: This is 57-year-old Joyce from Mutare. She is married with two children, both attending school. Joyce runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenges faced are high duty fees and transport costs. Joyce has requested a loan of $600 to buy more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in improving payment of school fees. In the future Joyce plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her parents).    Sofia has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sofia sells her products in her shop, by means of retail. Sofia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. 
The main business challenges for Sofia include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to buy a motor van to ease transportation.   Sofia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a gardener. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 30 years old. One of the children is in school and lives at home, while the oldest one is working and living on his own. For the past four years, she has been selling potatoes, greens, and ed-doe (a vegetable similar to taro) in the local market,  She is requesting a loan to purchase more potatoes, greens, and ed-doe for her business. She plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, greens and ed-doe

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 58 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village, an area of Sevan. Suren is married and he has two children: a daughter and a son. His son lives in Russia and his daughter, who is a translator, is jobless as she can’t find a job in their village.
 
Suren has graduated from Yerevan road-building technical training school and for 19 years, he worked at the Road-building Department as a master. 
Since 1998, Suren and his wife have been engaged in farming. They breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Part of the agricultural production they use for their family use and the other part they sell to dairy factory and the butcher’s shops and thus support their family.
 
This is Suren’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a $2,500 loan to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s the only support for his family and they really depend on him. He has been working as a bus driver since 2004 and has his loyal customers. In parallel, he works in a local school. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his bus in addition to painting. Otherwise, he may lose his loyal and trusty customers. This Kiva loan will allow him to transport people safely. In the future, he plans to organize trips all over the country during his free time.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and painting on his bus

loans.name: Leliosa

texts.en:
Leliosa is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Leliosa has a shop where she makes & sells banana cue, pancakes & hotcakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Leliosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Leliosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en:
Magrate lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is single and owns a retail shop which has been in operation for eight months. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined in order to access credit.
Magrate is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock eggs, potatoes, cereals and charcoal.
Her main challenges are inflation and high transport costs. Magrate wants to construct houses in future and will also save the extra income obtained from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock eggs, potatoes, cereals and charcoal.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 23 years old. She is the third born in a family of six. She is a single mother of one and currently lives in a small town called Katete located in the eastern part of Zambia. She runs her mobile money transfers business and she struggles to do her daily transactions because of low working capital. 

Martha has had to support herself ever since she was a child. At the young age of nine she had to start selling vegetables to help her mother raise money for food and school fees. She took everything she learned from her days of selling vegetables and opened her own hair salon as soon as she completed high school. She ran the salon for six months but had to close it down because she was not making any profit. She then started selling chickens and it was through running this business and interacting with different people that she learned about an organization that conducts HIV/AIDS training. She underwent the training and became a qualified HIV/AIDS care giver. In April 2011, while still working as a care giver, she got an opportunity to start running her own mobile money transfer business and took it. 

Having run her mobile money transfer business for close to 10 months now, she says she loves it because it gives her an opportunity to interact with different people and she gets to learn new things every day. She believes her community benefits from her business because they are able to send money in a quicker and safer way. 

Currently Martha only has working capital of $200, which is not enough to serve customers who want to send larger amounts of money and so she has no choice but to send them away. Martha is in dire need of this loan so that she can increase her working capital. She is confident this will give her more customers and more commission. 

In her video, Martha is being interviewed by a representative from mobile transactions.

loans.use: To increase her working capital so she can serve customers who want to send larger amounts of money

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old, single and he currently shares an apartment with two of his friends. He previously worked as a teller for eight months at another mobile money shop and because of his hard work he was given the chance to manage a shop of his own. He has run his own business for a month now and he describes himself as very hardworking, honest and dedicated. His business environment is great, he says, because where he's located there are many potential customers. 

Carlos wants to get a loan to increase his working capital as this will enable him to serve more customers. He hopes to open more mobile money outlets because he believes that his community benefits from his business by having an inexpensive way of moving their money in a safe environment. 

He currently has two people working for him and he hopes to employ more people as his business continues to grow. 

In the video, Carlos is being interviewed by a representative of Mobile Transactions

loans.use: To open more mobile money outlets

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a hotel (restaurant) that has been in operation for three years. She started it off through her savings.
Evalyne joined Milango to access credit to improve her business operation. Her main challenge is price fluctuation and inflation in purchasing stock. Evalyne is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more food products.
She looks forward to open a big restaurant and the extra income will be saved for emergency.

loans.use: To buy more food products.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is also a married mother of five children. Shee is a food vendor. She sold the farm produce to raise the capital required to start the business.
Shee is applying for a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase wheat and maize flour for her business. Her business faces the slight challenge of a  seasonal business climate and inflation. 
She would like to own a larger food supply venture in future through the savings she expects from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase wheat and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 28 years old. He is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married to Ruth. They have two children between three and one year old.

Harun is a farmer and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD  to enable him to boost his business and buy seedlings, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides.

He hopes to see his business improve and make a lot of income, which will help him improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, pesticides, insecticides,and fertilizers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Josephine has a tailoring shop where she makes, sells & repairs curtains, skirts, pants & uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Umaro's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 7,800,000.00 in order to help them pay school fees for their children or invest in business or buy pieces of furniture, or a plot of land, etc. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf

Umaru is the leader of this group of teachers. The 45 year old is a native of Matebo village. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Umaru has served in the teaching profession for 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Desmond S.l.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Binkolo, a village near Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, this group of teachers will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on these teachers’ behalf.

Desmond is the leader of this group of teachers. The fifty-five-year old is a native of Binkolo village. He is married to a housewife and the couple has three children who are attending secondary school. Desond has been a teacher for twenty-three years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, bags of cements, etc. for the future construction of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to build his house

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti lives in the Coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. She is a married mother of one and owns a building materials shop which has been in operation for the last ten years. The region has a lot of coconut trees which are used to make the thatching materials. Mwanasiti began by making a few pieces and sold to the nearby hotels and the local community.
Owing to the rising demand, she is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase house thatching materials for the business.  
Mwanasiti would like to accumulate enough money to start a hardware shop in future and supply other needed building materials.

loans.use: To purchase house thatching materials for her business.

loans.name: Paul M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan. These loans help these teachers and their counterparts within Makeni and other SMT’s operational areas to solve certain financial challenges that their salaries alone cannot solve. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

The leader of this group is Paul. Paul is a native of Binkolo village, near Makeni. The forty-five year old is married to a housewife and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Paul has been a teacher for nineteen years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is a 39-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 3 years to 18 years old. She describes herself to be determined and honest. She operates a grocery stall where she sells kale, tomatoes, onions, carrots etc. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located near a municipal council and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more onions, oranges, carrots and tomatoes. Phoebe's  business goal is to be a supplier in large quanties of vegetables and fruits within five years.

loans.use: to buy more onions, oranges, carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a student applying for a loan to pay for her tuition fees to help finish her undergraduate degree at Strathmore University. This is her story:
My name is Rosemary, a 19-year-old lady from Kenya. I live with my parents and two siblings. My sister is a second-year university student and my brother started high school this year.
I am a student at Strathmore University pursuing a bachelor of business degree in actuarial science. I am currently on my long holiday, which will see me join my second year when I resume class in April this year. Strathmore is one of the leading private universities in Africa offering quality education to its students, which is why I chose to study here.
This loan will enable me to focus on my studies without the uncertainties of being sent away from school in the course of the semester because of my fees balance and not being allowed to sit for my examinations. The assurance that I will complete my course without any financial setbacks will give me peace and help me concentrate on my classwork.
Upon graduation, I want to venture into the insurance field, especially life insurance and micro-insurance, where I want to apply my acquired skills and also get to learn more on the same. I hope to see an increase in the level of penetration of insurance in Kenya to a high level, probably higher than that in South Africa. Embracing of micro-insurance, especially among low income earners, is one of the best dreams I have for my country. The benefits of this will go a long way in providing a better lifestyle for most people and will also reduce the money spent to cover losses compared to if they had not been insured.
This loan will help me complete my studies without financial constraints and at the same time enable my parents to educate my other siblings. The repayment mode of the loan makes it possible for one to take up the loan and pay it in time.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to help her finish an undergraduate degree (Bachelor of Business Science in Actuarial Science) at Strathmore University

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 50 years old and a business lady.  She is married to Patrick who is a farmer.  They are blessed with four children aged 21, 19, 16 and 12 years.  

She has been a tailor for the past two years, earning a monthly income of 7,800 KES, which she uses to support her family.  Anastasia is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully.  Anastasia will use the loan to buy materials for making dresses. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.  In the future, she hopes and dreams to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy materials to make dresses.

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en:
Quinter is a student applying for a loan to pay for her tuition fees to help finish her undergraduate degree at Strathmore University. This is her story:

I am Quinter, aged 18 years, from Kenya. I come from a family of 8, I am the fourth born, my three siblings have only high school qualification,one is in high school and the youngest is in primary school. I am the only one pursuing university education. I am in my first year taking an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University.

I completed high school with the help of well-wishers in 2010. My excellent performance and improved skills in basketball led me to be called for by the UNICEF Talent Academy where I was exposed to many clubs including an outstanding, high-level performing institution that is Strathmore University. I applied for a sports scholarship, and luckily I was awarded 75% of my tuition fees. My father is having difficulties financing the remaining 25% of the tuition fee.He is not financially stable, and besides that my small business cannot help me raise this money in a stable way.

At the end of my degree course I dream of being an IT specialist, majoring on networking. Besides that, I wish to have a chance to get my basketball to a professional level, because it has been the virtue of my assistance to my academic progression and it’s my motivator in my struggles.

Through the Strathmore media I came to know about KIVA and felt the urge to apply for the 4 year maximum tuition loan to help me out of my struggle to raise the 25% of my fees.  With that at hand, I had to consider the thought to seek this loan to help see my dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to help her finish an undergraduate degree (Bachelor of Business Information Technology) at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Leonorah

texts.en:
Leonora is forty nine years old lady from Kimilili area of Kakamega town, West of Kenya and is widowed but with a responsibility of seven children who depends on her.

Leonora sells firewood in Kimilili town, a business she has done for the last four years making a monthly income of KES. 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to open another selling point. She plans to plow the profits back into business.

Her dream is to have many business outlets to maximize her profits.

loans.use: To open another wood selling point

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is 44 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Rose, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. 

He has been in the farming business for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET, after being introduced to it by a KADET staff member. Naphtali will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old, married, and blessed with two children, aged six and four.  He buys and sells cereals in Kaiboi trading centre and has been in operation for a period of six years earning a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

He is borrowing  a second loan cycle of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD , having successfully repaid the previous one, and wishes to use his second loan to purchase more bags of dry maize for resale.  

He will use the profits to start a retail shop for his wife.  He hopes to prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more dry maize for resale

loans.name: Jane Mbithe

texts.en:
Jane repaid her previous loan well and in good time. The farming had improved and she opened a retail shop which she is managing besides the farming.

She is applying for her sixth loan term from KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jane will use the loan to buy more seedlings and pesticides.
With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 26 years old and married. He is blessed with a three year old child. He sells clothes  a business he ventured into four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 21,000. 

Kennedy has requested a loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to purchase bales of clothes for sale. The profit he earns from this business will help him buy land and develop it. This is Kennedy's first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dinina Yuli

texts.es: Dinina es socia del Banco Comunal Trinidad, tiene 34 años, es casada, es madre de un hijo, y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, ella trabaja en una Posta de Salud, tiene una tienda de abarrotes y los domingos vende comida. Recuerda que antes solo era estudiante y no trabajaba, poco a poco ella pudo tener su negocio, esta muy bien con las capacitaciones que recibe porque le ayudaron a poder tener mas educación para sus préstamos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en: Dinina is a member of the Trinidad Communal Bank. She is 34 years-old, married, mother to a son, and has been a member of Finca Perú for 3 years. She works at a health center and has a grocery store. On Sundays she sells food. She remembers that before she was only a student and didn't work. Little by little she has been able to have her own business. She does very well with the trainings she receives because they helped her to be able to become more educated about her loans. She will invest the loan she's requesting in the purchase of groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 59 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Josephine, who is also a farmer.  They are blessed with one child.  He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan  of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. The anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. 


His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is 33 year old business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been selling fruits for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Emmah will use the loan to buy fresh fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to start a greengrocer business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for sale in her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old business man. He is single but supports his parents. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. David will use the loan to buy a spare parts for his  motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his siblings. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi, which will improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motor bike.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last five years.  She is 38 years old with a daughter who is 14 years old.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

In future, Mary hopes to grow her clothing business and open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has operated her veterinary business in Olkalou town for the last three years. She is 44 years old and has a daughter who is 22 years old.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more agro-chemicals and veterinary drugs to add to her stock.

In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her retail business to a wholesale one.

loans.use: To buy more agro-chemicals and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia es socia del Banco Comunal Trinidad, tiene 54 años, ella es una mujer que trabajaba mucho, de lunes a jueves viaja para vender ropa en las ferias, los sábados trabaja en su chacra, y los domingos vende comida, ella aprendió a trabajar bien en Finca, gracias a los préstamos que le dan pudo comprarse una chacra, ahora ella se siente muy bien porque puede tener una estabilidad económica, pudo educar a sus hijos. Ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para llevar a las ferias.
texts.en: Mauricia is a member of the Trinidad Communal Bank and is 54 years-old. She's a hardworking woman. From Monday to Thursday she travels to sell clothing in the markets. On Saturdays she works on her small farm and on Sundays she sells food. She learned to work well at Finca. Thanks to the loans they have given her she was able to buy herself a small farm. Now she feels very good because she can have financial stability. She was able to educate her children. She will now invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to take to the markets.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Warakaq, es dueña de una imprenta, y tambien vende fruta y golosinas en la puerta de su imprenta, de lunes a viernes en la mañana solo 2 horas atiende en un cafetín de un colegio, trata de ver la forma de obtener mayores ingresos. Finca Perú le enseñó a no ser conformista y a esforzarse, con las capacitaciones aprendió acerca de la responsabilidad y el compañerismo, su sueño es poder tener otra imprenta, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fruta y golosinas.
texts.en: Maura is a member of the communal bank Muchuy Warakaq.  She owns a print business and also sells fruit and sweets at the door of her shop.   Monday through Friday, two hours a morning, she works in the school coffee shop, as she is always looking for ways to increase her income.  Finca Perú taught her not to conform and make an effort through the training she learned about responsibility and team spirit.  Her dream is to open another printing business.  With the current loan she will buy fruit and sweets.

loans.use: To buy fruits and sweets.

loans.name: Dorisa

texts.es: Dorisa es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 39 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es dueña de un restaurante,  agradece porque en Finca le han ayudado y enseñado a trabajar bien y a administrar su negocio, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a tener buena asesoría, a ser buena socia gracias a la puntualidad y la responsabilidad, ella se esforzó mucho porque es madre soltera, y sabe que las dificultades no la pueden detener para seguir adelante, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra abarrotes de primera necesidad para el restaurante.
texts.en: Dorisa is a member of the communal bank Generosidad.  She is 39 years old and the mother of three children.  She owns a restaurant and is grateful to Finca for the support it has given her along with training in how to work well and manage a business.  The courses have taught her to get good advice and be a good member in terms of punctuality and responsibility.  She has worked hard as a single mother and knows that difficulties must not stand in the way of her getting ahead.  The loan will be used to buy essential groceries for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 29 años, es madre de 1 hijo, se dedica la venta de gas, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 años, ella pudo aumentar su capital gracias a las capacitaciones, donde le enseñaron a tener las herramientas para que su negocio progrese, también aprendió sobre la responsabilidad y la honradez, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de balones de gas.
texts.en: Carmen is a member of the communal bank Generosidad.  She is 29 years old and has a son.  She sells gas for a living and has been a member of Finca Perú for three years.  She was able to increase her capital thanks to training courses which taught her about the tools she needed for her business to get ahead.  She also learned about responsibility and honesty.  The loan will be used to buy gas cylinders.

loans.use: To buy wholesale gas.

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 29 años, es madre de 2 hijos, María tiene una Cevichería, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, agradece la facilidad con la que recibe los préstamos que le brindan, al ingresar ella tenía solo algo mínimo, poco a poco fue incrementado el préstamo y así ha logrado que su negocio crezca, puede ver como se incrementan sus ingresos y sus ahorros, esta muy satisfecha con su trabajo.
Gracias a las capacitaciones ha aprendido a trazarse metas y ahora ella esta cumpliendo todo lo que se propuso, le gusta la forma de trabajo y el ahorro programado. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de víveres para la cevicheria.
texts.en: María is a member of the communal bank Generosidad.  She is 29 years old and the mother of two children.  María has a Cevichería (restaurant) and has been a member of Finca Perú for a year.  She is grateful for the easy loan terms she receives.  When she joined, she took out only a small loan but has been able to increase the amount gradually and make her business grow, with increased income and savings.  She is very satisfied with her work.  Thanks to the training she has received she has established goals and is meeting them.  She likes the work format and savings program.  The loan will be used to buy food products for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Noelia Araceli

texts.es:
Noelia es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 30 años, es madre de una niño, se dedica a la venta de ropa, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, recuerda que ella empezó solo con pedido y en poca cantidad, con Finca ella fue creciendo, ahora ya reparte ropa en mayor cantidad.
Agradece por las capacitaciones recibidas, porque le ayudaron a poder educar a su hijo, Noelia es madre soltera, pero con su esfuerzo pudo salir adelante, ahora esta muy bien en su negocio, le va muy bien, gracias a las ganancias pudo comprarse sus artefactos de primera necesidad para su hogar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa.
texts.en: Noelia is a member of the communal bank Generosidad.  She is 30 years old and has a son.  She sells clothing for a living and has been a member of Finca Perú for four years.  She remembers starting her business with only one order for a small amount.  Through Finca she has grown and now sells larger volumes of clothing.  She is grateful for the training she has received because it has helped her educate her son.  Noelia is a single mother but through her efforts has been able to get ahead.  Now her business is going well and thanks to her earnings she has been able to buy basic items for her household.  The loan is to buy clothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children, who are both studying. She cooperates with her husband to better support her family. Rania started her own job at an early age; she opened her own beauty salon in 2007. She has her loyal customers, and is glad with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more beauty products and cosmetics for her salon.  In this way, she hopes to please her customers, and to be able to work better. In the future, she plans to open a new laser area.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 49 years-old. She lives in the village of Zikilia, South Georgia with her family including her husband Amiran, her 21 year-old son, and father-in-law (retired). Amiran is a joiner and has a small workshop, where he produces various wooden products. Nana and her son are running family agricultural business. They have two milking cows. Nana produces cheese. The family also has one hectare of agricultural land, where potatoes and haricots are grown. Nana sells haricots, potatoes, and cheese on local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 510 Laris, including the pension of Nana’s father-in-law. 

Nana requested credit for purchasing seeds of potatoes. After sowing quality potatoes, Nana will receive quality harvest in summer, and will sell it for a convenient price. She will use the received income for purchasing household goods to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of potatoes

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en: Awatef is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only one parent. She’s cooperating with her husband who’s working as a musician in order to fulfill their family needs. As for her, she has owned a tailoring factory since 2006. She’s stylish and fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added textiles such as cotton, silk, and many other tailoring products.  She notes that this will improve her business and therefore increase her productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop and also expand her business outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase added textiles such as cotton, silk, and many other tailoring products

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 23 year-old, single man from Ndunyu Njeru. He does farming, and has been in this business for the past one year.

George has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him boost his business by buying pesticides and fertilizers. He was introduced by a fellow client.

He hopes to see his business expand and make lot of profit to help him improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers.
