texts.en:
Joselen is married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joselen is 41 years old and both her children are in school.

Joselen has a lechon (roasted pig) business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more pigs for her lechon business. She has been in this business for 3 years.  

In the future, Joselen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for her lechon business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is married and has a business selling kitchenware in the Philippines.

Ofelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more kitchenware and clothing to sell. Ofelia has been in this business for sixteen years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more kitchenware and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is forty-three years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Susan has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergents, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Myrene

texts.en: This time, for her seventh loan, Myrene is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her fishing business. The fishing/fish selling business that she previously funded through NWTF and its partner Kiva continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, a 32-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For the last two years, Marites has been running a general store in the Philippines selling a variety of items such as eggs, spices, soft drinks, snack foods, sardines, etc.

Now requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “NUEVA ESPERANZA” se inicio en el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya hace 1 año, buscando alcanzar independencia y crecimiento económico, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas.
Cynthia es miembro del grupo y comenta que gracias a las ventas de comidas que hace ha podido ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena mano para la comida, es por ello que le va muy bien. Su meta es poder tener algún día un bar donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para seguir preparando los alimentos que vende, como ser panificados, verduras, aderezos y demás. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" communal bank started a year ago in the Enterprising Women program of Fundación Paraguaya. Its members are seeking to achieve independence and financial growth. All the members are already carrying out productive activities. 

Cynthia is a group member and says that thanks to the food she sells, she has been able to help her family.  She says she has a talent for cooking, and this is why it's going very well. Her goal is to be able to someday have a bar where she can serve her customers more conveniently. 

She is applying for the loan to buy ingredients she needs to continue preparing the food she sells, such as baked goods, vegetables, seasonings and other things. She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Solar Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Solar” paso al séptimo ciclo del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras”, cuenta con 17 integrantes, quienes trabajan de forma conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y mutuo respeto.
Matilde es la miembro del grupo, y nos comenta que es modista desde hace un buen tiempo. En su barrio es muy conocida por la buena calidad de las prendas que realiza. Ella comenta que le va muy bien pues la mayoría de sus vecinos siempre le traen trabajos para hacer.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo en su negocio. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The “Solar” women's committee completed its seventh cycle in “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” program. It has 17 members who work together in an environment of cooperation and mutual respect.

Matilde is a member of the group and she tells us that she has been a seamstress for a while. She is well known in her neighborhood for the good quality of the clothes she makes. She tells us that it is going well for her because most of her neighbors always bring her work to do.   

She is asking for the loan to buy fabric and thread, with which she can continue working and growing in his business. She is thankful for the help she receives from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Daniel Diogenes

texts.es:
Daniel Diogenes  tiene 53  años es casado, vive con la esposa tiene 4 hijos todos son mayores de edad y no vive con él. Vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La Ventanilla EL SAGRADO CORAZON, esta ventanilla se encuentra ubicada en el sector de las calles Ernesto Briones y Parroquia 10 de Noviembre, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica al Comercio.
El señor Daniel Diogenes se dedica al trabajo de Ebanista, es decir a la confección de muebles de madera.
El dinero lo va invertir en la compra de madera, clavos y tapis para los muebles.

Las compras de los insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventas donde el Señor Juan Arevalo. El crédito les ayudado a aumentar la producción y tener productos de calidad, el sueño de Daniel Diogenes es tener un negocio más grande, ha enfrentado desafíos como los precios altos de madera que es la materia prima.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer las revistas comicas.
texts.en:
Daniel Diogenes is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife.  He has four children who are all adults and no longer live with him.  He lives in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'El Sagrado Corazón' (Sacred Heart) community bank is located in the neighborhood around Ernesto Briones and Parroquia 10 de Noviembre streets, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in commerce.

Daniel Diogenes works as a furniture maker.  He makes furniture from wood.  He will invest his money in buying wood, nails and coverings for his furniture.  He buys his supplies in the city of Ventas from Mr Juan Arevalo.  His loan helped him to increase his production and make good quality products.  Daniel Diogenes' dream is to have a bigger business.  He has faced challenges in his work such as the high cost of wood which is the raw material he uses.

In his free time, Daniel Diogenes enjoys reading comic strips.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and coverings for the furniture he makes

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is one of twenty-one members of the village bank “Sumac Ayllu” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Petronila is thirty-seven years old and married with two children who are nine and eighteen. She has a storefront in which she offers photocopying services. She often supplies services for events such as funerals, baptisms, and parties.

Petronila is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials such as paper and another photocopying machine for her four-year-old business. Her dream is to expand her business and to support her children so that they can attain professional degrees.

loans.use: to purchase paper and another photocopying machine.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 42 years old living in Catadman, Ozamis City with her 4 children. Arlene puts up a carenderia-type of business (local eatery) which she started 2 years ago. She usually gets 2,500 PHP a month. Her interest in cooking inspired her to invest in this kind of business. With the desire to improve it, she borrows an amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit this year to purchase additional cooking ingredients. In God’s time, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City. She earns PHP 2,000 monthly through gardening so as to support the needs of her seven children. For a forty-four-year old mother, there’s nothing that can make her happier than to see her children successful in their studies. 

This year, Helen is borrowing an amount of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her plan in the future is to hopefully to improve her business so as to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is fifty-three years old and lives in, Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with five adult-aged children.
 
Josefina has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Josefina has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Josefina hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old. She is a widow and has two children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jenelyn has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lalyn

texts.en:
Lalyn is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lalyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lalyn has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 55 years old, married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been farming rice for 30 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 43 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business of Avon and MSE products in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.  She also earns additional income from a bakery.

Myrna is requesting her eighth loan for 28,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase more items to sell.  Myrna has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish-vending  business.

Nelly has been in this business for seven years. Nelly earns additional income from raising pigs.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is sixty-two years old, married, with five children. 

Norma has a business buying and selling herbal products in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal products to sell.

Norma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio's Group

texts.en:
Virgilio is married with three children. Virgilio is 44 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Virgilio is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. He has been doing this for 15 years. He has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to be used for purchasing fertilizers and pay labor costs for his banana production. 

Virgilio joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Virgilio hopes to expand his area of production. Virgilio is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and labor costs for banana production

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 32 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

Perlita works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Perlita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Perlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Las Amigas es el grupo que está integrado por 18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, todas ellas son amigas y vecinas que se decidieron unir para trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo 17 del programa de la fundación paraguaya, y han demostrado un buen trabajo.
Emiliana es una de las miembros, y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo). Ella vende por todo su barrio y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos se ha hecho de buena fama y ha podido crecer y convertirse en una buena microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y de esa forma seguir trabajando.Su sueño es poder tener un local donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Las Amigas is a lending group composed of 18 women in the city of Caacupé. They are very hardworking and entrepreneurial people, and all of them are friends and neighbors that decided to unite to work together and in this way be able to help each other. Currently they are in the 17th cycle of the program of Fundación Paraguaya, and they have demonstrated good work. 

Emiliana is one of the members, and she tells us that she dedicates herself to the sale of chipas (a typical Paraguayan food). She sells all over her neighborhood and thanks to the high quality of her products she has become well known and has been able to become a good micro entrepreneur. 

She is asking for this loan to buy chipas, with which she will be able to sustain herself and in this way continue working. Her dream is to one day have a locale where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy chipas (a typical Paraguayan food) to later sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también actividades con las cuales pueden fomentar su compañerismo y su unión.
Maria es una de las miembros, nos comenta que ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser gallinas y cerdos. Este trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que es de tiempo completo, pues debe de estar pendiente de sus animales las 24 horas. Su sueño es poder tener una granja donde criar a muchos tipos de animales.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de lechones y pollitos para la cría y posterior venta. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group “Maria Auxiliadora” formed from the union of various neighbors in the city of Santaní. All of the members of the group are engaged in independent activities, but also activities that can help develop their companionship and union. 

Maria is one of the members, and she tells us that she works to raise animals such as chickens and pigs. This work is very demanding and full time, as she must attend to her animals 24 hours a day. Her dream is to be able to have a farm where she raises many types of animals. 

She is asking for this loan to buy chicks and piglets to raise and later sell. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy chicks and piglets to raise

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
San Antonio de Padua se denomina el grupo formado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas desean ayudar a sus familias a salir adelante y a tener un futuro mejor del que les toco vivir.
Una de las miembros es la señora Gladys, quien cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a su vecindario. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde tempranas horas del día y deja de trabajar ya muy entrada la noche. Su meta es seguir agrandando su negocio y de esa forma tener un mayor ingreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de de harina, huevo, queso, fideo, arroz, aceite, yerba, azúcar, sal, etc, con lo cual podrá surtir bien su local.
texts.en:
San Antonio de Padua is a group comprised of 15 women from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  They are hard workers and fighters who joined together to help each other by working together.  They want to help their families get ahead and have a better life than the ones they have had.  

One of the members is Gladys, who has a well-stocked shop that supplies her neighborhood.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She starts work every day very early and works until late into the night.  Her goal is to continue growing her business to increase her income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, cheese, fideo pasta, rice, oil, yerba, sugar, salt etc., which she will be able to use to stock her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Danil es un joven de 26 años de edad, el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.

El inicio su negocio con dos vacas que le heredo su padre y con las crías ha ido aumentando. Desde hace varios años que Danil tiene este negocio del ganado lechero, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con una propiedad, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Danil está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de dos vacas lecheras más, para poder continuar con su producción de leche y de queso. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es tener un mejor resultado en su trabajo para obtener una excelente calidad de vida tanto para él como la de su familia. 

Danil es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo, él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man of 26 who lives together with his wife and children in La Fuente, in Cartago province.  The main drainage channel in this area is the Reventazón River which has its source in the Cuericí Hills.  Owing to the fertile nature of its volcanic and alluvial soil, the main sources of income in this area are farming and livestock raising.

Daniel started his business with two cows that he inherited from his father and, with their offspring, he has increased his herd.  Daniel has been in the dairy business for several years.  He has property but lacks the money he needs to make progress in his business and to ensure that the neighbors in his community benefit.  The project is very interesting to him.

Daniel is requesting a micro loan for 500,000 colones to buy two additional dairy cows so that he can continue producing milk and cheese.  In this way, he hopes to grow his business as his goal is to obtain better results from his work in order to provide both himself and his family with an excellent quality of life.

Daniel is a member of the Fuente Agrícola community loan company, one of 150 such organizations which are associated with EDESA in Costa Rica.  He hopes to use his loan to continue growing on both a personal and financial level whilst participating actively within the loan organization in his community.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is sixty-three years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. 

Maura has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. 

Maura has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Maura hopes to earn money in order to help her husband and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Alona's Group

texts.en:
Alona is forty-five years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with eight children. 

To earn a living, Alona has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Alona has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional ingredients and raw materials for her snack-vending business.

Alona has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Alona would like to introduce her products to another location. Alona is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and ingredients for her snacks business.

loans.name: Glory Fe

texts.en:
Glory Fe is married with three children. Glory Fe is 52 years old and lives in Taguima, Tudela.

Glory Fe is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. Glory Fe has been doing this for 10 years. Glory Fe has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additonal fertilizer for planting rice crops.

Glory Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Glory Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additonal fertilizer for planting rice crops

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita is married with four children. Dolorita is 40 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban.

Dolorita is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. Dolorita has been doing this for 20 years. Dolorita has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops. 

Dolorita has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Dolorita hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for planting crops

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 45 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Agapita is married with four children. 

Agapita has a general store that sells a variety of products. Agapita has had this business for 20 years. Agapita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.  

Agapita has been a member of PMPC for five months.  In the future, Agapita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Alicia is married with five children. 

Alicia has a general store that sells a variety of products. Alicia has had this business for 15 years. Alicia requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en: Sabrina, a 38-year-old married mother of one, lives in Estrella, Sinacaban where she has been operating a dress shop that sells dress-making materials for three years. A member of PMPC for four months, Sabrina is requesting a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase additional dress-making materials. In  the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dress-making materials.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is fifty-one years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban. Florencia is married with two children.
 
To earn a living, Florencia has a business selling food snacks. Florencia earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Florencia has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

Florencia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Florencia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar and oil.

loans.name: Maritchel

texts.en:
Maritchel is thirty years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Maritchel is married with two children.
 
To earn a living, Maritchel has a business selling snacks in the local community. Maritchel earns about PHP 1,200 each month doing this type of work. 
Maritchel has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, oil, etc.

Maritchel has been a member of PMPC for five months. In the future, Maritchel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar and oil.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is sixty-five years old and lives in Libertad,Bajo, Sinacaban. Purita is married with four children. 

Purita has a general store that sells variety of products. Purita has had this business for thirty years. Purita requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Purita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Purita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecelia is fifty-three years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is single.

Cecilia has a boarding house business and earns approximately PHP 7,100 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase materials for her boarding house.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for four months. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her boarding house.

loans.name: Amanda Lissett

texts.es: Amanda es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas, también estudia un curso de diseño gráfico. Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de una computadora, y así poder poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos y también hacer sus investigaciones. Dentro de algunos años se ve hablando inglés con otras personas, extranjeros. Y siendo jefa del departamento de sistemas de una empresa grande. La computadora sería su herrmaienta de estudio. Su hermana le apoyó en el pago de un curso de inglés.
texts.en: Amanda is young student studying systems engineering.  She is also studying graphic design. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer. She can put into practice her acquired skills and also do research. In a few years, she sees herself speaking English with other people, like foreigners. She also sees herself being the systems manager at a big company. The computer would be a study tool. Her sister supports her with the payment for an English course.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia, de 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 20 y 15 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en su propia donde reina la paz. La actividad que realiza Octavia, es muy trabajoso pero ella dice: “que no hay nada difícil en la vida, con la finalidad de tener buena salud y un buen bienestar”; Octavia sabe las dificultades de trabajar en el campo y sobre todo para una mujer; es por eso que su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en los deberes. Hace 35 años que empezó a labrar la tierra; desde muy tempranas horas se dirigía a su chacra no importaba si hacia lluvia pero tenia que mantener sus plantas alejadas de las plagas que afectan. Por tal motivo acuden a MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus planes de trabajo. Con el tiempo desea en incrementar con más plantas de café; porque sabe que son beneficiosos con las ventas y de esa manera obtener una estabilidad económica. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está seguro que con su grupo comunal llegara muy lejos, ya que le trae muchos beneficios. Con los 500 nuevos soles, le dará un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café respectivamente, para ello comprará insumos y abonos de primera calidad.
texts.en: Octavia is 57 years old, she is married and has 2 children who are 20 and 15. They live together peacefully in their own home. Octavia’s work demands a lot of effort, but she says: “Nothing is hard in life when you aim to have good health and wellbeing”. Octavia knows about the difficulties of working in the fields, especially for a woman; it is for this reason that her husband and children help her out. She started plowing the land 35 years ago. She went to her fields very early, no matter if it was raining; she had to keep the pests that affected her plants away from them.   It is for this reason that she has turned to MFP to request a loan that will help her carry out her work plans. In time, she wants to increase the number of coffee plants she has, because she knows the crop sells well and they will help her to achieve economic stability. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is committed to continue paying on time. In addition, she is sure that she will go far with her community group, as it provides her with many benefits. With the 500 Nuevos Soles of the loan, she will provide her coffee plantations with adequate maintenance. She will buy high quality inputs and fertilizers for this.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina de 26 años, es una mujer amable, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 02 queridos hijos, Carlos de 09 años y Gabriela de 06 años; a quien desea una mejor calidad de vida. Paulina, es una mujer de trabajo, le gusta la vida del campo, hace 10 años empezó a laborar cultivando plantas café, que con gran esfuerzo ah logrado obtener. En tiempos de cosecha normalmente pide el apoyo de los jornaleros para que puedan extraer de manera fácil sus frutos, Paulina considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con las plagas que afectan la producción de sus plantas. Por ello desde que se entero sobre los préstamos que MFP realizaba pues no dudo en acercarse para consultar con su asesor; ahora gracias al apoyo puede cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además respalda a su grupo comunal por la buena organización que tienen. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, le servirá para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a su producto como el café , comprando insumos y abonos.
texts.en: Twenty-six-year-old Paulina is a kind woman.  She lives in her own home with her two beloved children, nine-year-old Carlos and six-year-old Gabriela, for whom she wants a better quality of life.  Paulina is a hardworking woman who likes to live in the country.  Through a lot of effort, she was able to get coffee plants and start cultivating them ten years ago.  During harvest season she normally asks for the help of laborers to collect her produce more easily.  Paulina tells us that the most difficult thing is not being able to fight the pests that affect her plants' production.  That is why, as soon as she found out about the loans MFP gave out, she didn't hesitate to go for a consultation with her adviser.  Now, thanks to their help, she can carry out her work plans.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time.  She also supports her communal group because of its good organization.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, she will give her produce, such as coffee, the maintenance it needs by buying supplies and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer
